definition: Taipei Stock Exchange, abbr. for 臺北股市|台北股市[Tai2 bei3 Gu3 shi4]

thigh/part of a whole/portion of a sum/(stock) share/strand of a thread/low-level administrative unit, translated as "section" or "department" etc, ranked below 科[ke1]/classifier for long winding things like ropes, rivers etc/classifier for smoke, smells etc: thread, puff, whiff/classifier for bands of people, gangs etc/classifier for sudden forceful actions
Hang Seng index (of Hong Kong stock market)
to regurgitate/(fig.) (of a stock market) to give up (gains)
Dow Jones Industrial Average (abbr. for 道瓊斯指數|道琼斯指数[Dao4 Qiong2 si1 Zhi3 shu4])
Hon Hai Precision Industry Company, Taiwan technology company, aka Foxconn
NASDAQ/National Association of Securities Dealers Automated Quotations, a computerized data system to provide brokers with price quotations for securities traded over the counter
to shake up/to jolt/to vibrate/to oscillate/to fluctuate
Hong Kong Stock Exchange/abbr. for 香港交易所
